plants.name: Rhododendron ponticum
plants.description: An evergreen shrub with large clusters of bell-shaped flowers, often in shades of pink to purple. It thrives in mild temperate climates and is commonly found in woodlands and hilly areas.
plants.location: Temperate regions of Europe and Western Asia
plants.funFact: Rhododendron ponticum is known for its invasive tendencies in some parts of the UK, outcompeting native plants due to its dense shade and toxins in leaf litter.

plants.name: Lilium candidum
plants.description: A fragrant, tall lily with elegant white trumpet-shaped flowers. It prefers Mediterranean climates and is often cultivated in gardens for its beauty and scent.
plants.funFact: Madonna Lily has been cultivated since ancient times and was considered sacred in many cultures, often associated with purity and the Virgin Mary.

plants.name: Erythrina crista-galli
plants.description: A small deciduous tree known for its bright red, spiky, pea-like flowers that attract hummingbirds and other pollinators.
plants.bloomingSeason: Spring to early summer (September to November in Southern Hemisphere)
plants.location: South America (Argentina, Uruguay, Brazil) and cultivated in subtropical regions worldwide
plants.funFact: Erythrina crista-galli is the national flower of Argentina and Uruguay, and its wood was traditionally used to make tools and musical instruments.

plants.name: Magnolia stellata
plants.description: A deciduous shrub or small tree with large, fragrant, star-shaped white to pale pink flowers. It blooms very early in spring before the leaves appear, often in April.
plants.location: Japan and cultivated in temperate gardens worldwide
plants.funFact: Star Magnolia was first discovered in Japan in the early 19th century and is often used as an ornamental plant in early spring gardens due to its striking flowers.
